channel.title: NpcDB Project
channel.description:
I started working on a PHP Fully working search for every single NPC in Runescape up to 525 NPC's I believe. Still trying to find a dump for 604+. With Correct Names and ID's.
I will add images if I can find a dump for one.
But yea, i'am starting to work on the Object Database and Item Database with fully working search functions and pagination.
But here it is; http://trilocus.net/database
Not adverting one bit. Just wanted to show the community.
If wrong section just move.

item.title: NpcDB Project
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I believe (if anything) it might contain the max health. The determines the perceived health from there. If that is the case, then the server must have the same value, otherwise, there may be some discrepancies (ie. The npc having 0 health serverside, but dying when it looks like they have 50% left to the player)

Read full topic

item.title: NpcDB Project
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Native^, post:23, topic:438014”]the cache contains:
walking emote
running emote
turn 180 degrees emote
turn 90 degrees cw emote
and the turn 90 degrees ccw emote.
size
etc.

not hp, imagine how many hackers would have set the mobs hp to 1 or something.[/quote]

HP has to be included iirc because how else would you calculate hits on a Npc?

Read full topic

item.title: NpcDB Project
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

not 100% sure on HP, but I know for a fact it has the npcs walking emote. it doesnt, however, contain attacking, dying, or blocking emotes.

Read full topic

item.title: NpcDB Project
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“dain bramage, post:18, topic:438014”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=540733.msg3961550#msg3961550 date=1333328171]
There would still be things that wouldn’t be known from the cache (health, animations, etc). And since the only thing the client cares about it “visible” data (model, name, id, description, etc) having the health and such in the client would be ineffective. Since most of the work here is done on the server-side, a more appropriate use of the database would be the things the server has control over.

Unless you’re just talking about a map of id to name, then by all means go ahead.
[/quote]
It has both the health and animations of the NPC in the cache…[/quote]
cache does not contain HP values.
nor does it have animations.

Read full topic

item.title: NpcDB Project
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

zyle1992:

It shouldnt because those are values that are sent by the server. If they were, then someone could edit the cache and chamge the values (or at least fake them)

Server uses the cache to find the NPC’s HP and sends it to the client (which also has it).
The Server needs to cache (for walking, etc).
They don’t make a separate cache for the client, since the client uses the servers cache for updating.
Spoofing the values would make it visible to the client but won’t actually change the NPCs HP.
Hell, I can spoof the client into saying I hit 100,000.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:

Since most of the work here is done on the server-side, a more appropriate use of the database would be the things the server has control over.

Unless you’re just talking about a map of id to name, then by all means go ahead.[/quote]
